arm_group.description: All subjects will undergo spontaneous ventilation through an impedance threshold device and ScvO2 will be recorded before and after

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether analysis of near infrared absorbance
      signals that occur at different frequencies might provide information about the difference
      in oxygen saturation between arterial and venous blood.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Near Infrared Spectroscopy to Measure Intracranial ScvO2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult 18-65 years of age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Dilated cardiomyopathy

          -  Congestive heart failure

          -  Pulmonary hypertension

          -  Severe aortic stenosis

          -  Flail chest

          -  Chest pain

          -  Shortness of breath

intervention.intervention_name: Use of impedance threshold device during spontaneous ventilation

link.description: UVA Technology in Anesthesia and Critical Care Research Group

primary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation will be calculated from the five minute period of time prior to use of the impedance threshold device (0-4 mins), and then again in the 2 minute period after the impedance threshold device is applied (5-6 mins)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 5 to 6:59 minutes after applying the impedance threshold device

reference.citation: Thiele RH, Tucker-Schwartz JM, Lu Y, Gillies GT, Durieux ME. Transcutaneous regional venous oximetry: a feasibility study. Anesth Analg. 2011 Jun;112(6):1353-7. doi: 10.1213/ANE.0b013e3182166a26.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
